titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Pollard and William Wing, Indictment
CWG7386

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } November Term 1865.
Thomas Pollard & William Wing.

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Thomas Pollard and William Wing of the crime of Stealing a mule committed as follows, viz: The said Thomas Pollard and William Wing on the 10" day of June 1864 in the County of aforesaid willfully and feloniously took and carried one Bay horse mule the personal property of William Stinebaugh and of the value of One hundred dollars against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

John J McLin
Foreman Grand Jury
E P Campbell Attorney for the Commonwealth

Information given by=
William Stinebaugh
John D Irvin
David Alsup
N M Nichols
Bench Warrant to Issue & bail fixed at $200. each

R T Petree
a copy
atteste F W Dabney D C

Comlth
v } Indictment for Stealing a mule
Pollard & Wing
a true bill
John J McLin
Foreman Grand Jury
Filed & noted in open Court Decr 2d 1865,
att J C Barnes clk
a copy
